title: [K-12] Simulation/VR-Based Foundational Legal Education Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic legal terminology and fundamental concepts of contract law
context.additional_context: Law education course based on lecture capture in VR simulations using personal devices. Continuously monitors learning effectiveness through formative assessments, focusing on improving practical skills via legal case analysis

learning_goals: Students can analyze case-by-case scenarios of contract lawâ€™s core principles (obligation, performance, breach) in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can accurately define and apply over 90% of legal terminology using recorded lecture materials.

Participants analyze three situational decision-making tasks (time/budget/safety conditions) in a VR-based mock contract signing scenario (e.g., negotiation for purchasing scientific lab equipment) and write a decision-making report achieving an "average" or higher grade in at least four of five rubric items (clarity, validity, creativity, realism, collaboration).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
